Detailed Description

The core input/output class.

Is inherited by most I/O classes, including CoreConsole, TextReader and TextWriter. Programmers can write their own I/O classes which inherit CoreIO.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum CoreIO::LineEndingType

Line ending conventions.

An enumeration of different ending types.

Enumerator:
CR  Carriage return only. (default for UNIX and UNIX-like systems, Linux, AIX, Xenix, Mac OS X, BeOS, Amiga, RISC OS and others)
LF  Line feed only. (default for Commodore machines, Apple II family and Mac OS through version 9)
CRLF  Carriage return and line feed. (default for CP/M, MP/M, DOS, Microsoft Windows)

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CoreIO::CoreIO ( FILE *  _fileBuffer  ) 

The constructor.

Creates a new CoreIO instance. Will initialize line endings to the platform's default, also initializes CoreIO::m_ioMutex.

Parameters:
_fileBuffer The buffer to be used for I/O operations.

Moves forward to a location in the buffer.

_bufferIndex The position in _buffer to begin writing.

char CoreIO::Read (  ) 

Reads one byte from the file buffer.

Returns:
A char containing the next byte from the buffer.

const char * CoreIO::ReadLine (  ) 

Reads a line of data.

Data returned by this function should be copied to another location before being parsed.

WARNING: This function is NOT thread-safe. A fix for this is in the works.
Returns:
A pointer to the next line of data.

int CoreIO::Seek ( int  _position,
int  _origin 
) [protected]

Seeks to a location in the buffer.

Parameters:
_position Position to seek to, relative to _origin.
_origin Can be one of SEEK_SET, SEEK_CUR, or SEEK_END.
Returns:
An integer indicating the result of the operation. 0 indicates success. Any non-zero number indicates failure.

Seeks to a location in the buffer.

Member Data Documentation

FILE* CoreIO::m_fileBuffer [protected]

Input/output buffer.

CoreMutex* CoreIO::m_ioMutex [protected]

Thread-safe mutex.

Prevents more than one read or write from occurring simultaneously.

char* CoreIO::m_lineEnding [protected]

Line ending buffer.

Stores the line ending selected by CoreIO::SetLineEndings.
